subject: Re: Hamcrest Type mismatch
msgSnippet: Kevin, I don t see why actual is declared as Object? It looks like Hamcrest is written correctly in this respect. Cheers, David ... Matcher ) ...
messageBody:
Kevin,

I don't see why 'actual' is declared as Object? It looks like Hamcrest
is written correctly in this respect.

Cheers,
David

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Kevin Lawrence" <kev.lawrence@...> wrote:
>
> I have been playing with Hamcrest a little and I keep running across a
> problem with generic type being mismatched in assertThat().
>
> Example:
>
> Object actual = "a string";
> assertThat(actual, is("a string"));
>
> The compiler says:
>
> <T>assertThat(T, Matcher<T>) cannot be applied to (Object,
Matcher<String>)
>
> I can work around it by casting the expected value to object, or the
actual
> value to String...
>
> assertThat(actual, is((object) "a string"));
>
> Am I doing something wrong? Is there a better approach? A better
workaround?
> Should I just suck it up?
>
> Another list where I should be asking questions about Hamcrest?
>
> --
> Kevin
>
> http://www.junitfactory.com
> You send us code. We send you tests. For free.
